page.title: 05A71 By-Pass East Calder
page.content: The A71 By-pass was built in 1979 and opened in 1980 to decrease the traffic travelling through East Calder Main Street and Mid Calder.It helps people travelling from Livingston and the West of Scotland to Edinburgh. The By-pass was built through Oakbank Shale Bing and over the R.Linhouse.It cut through several farms which caused some problems: cattle had to go under the road through a cattle creek;new field drains had to be built;passing drivers threw litter;land was lost. To-day part of a field is still wet; fences need to be repaired in case cattle get on to the road;crossing the road with tractors and trailers is difficult. Traffic in Main St has decreased but Langton Rd. is busier.Local trade has not been affected because more houses have been built in East Calder.
